extendedInfo.description: **You must own a Synology NAS to run this app, and be running the latest Audio Station 5.1 to get all listed features**Discover a new and pleasant way to enjoy music on your Android phones and tablets wherever an Internet connection is available. DS audio allows you to browse your DiskStationâs music library while playing it in the background, as well as displaying the lyrics of the song being played. Better yet, you can download songs to your Android deviceâs local memory to listen to them even when no network is available. You can also control music playback on connected speakers in a simple and convenient way.With DS audio on Android Phones and Tablets, you can do the following:-Play music stored on your DiskStation on-the-go-Browse songs by albums, artists, composers, folders, genres or playlist-Create and edit your own playlists (DSM 4.3 beta and Audio Station 5.1 required)-Download to local memory for Offline listening 	-Listen to your favourite Internet radio -Use DS audio as a remote to stream music from your DiskStation to any attached speakers (Airplay-enabled / DLNA / UPnP media renderers)-Connect with your QuickConnect ID (requires DSM 4.2)-Support of HTTPS connection for Android 3.1 and onwards-Support for encrypted login over HTTP without SSL	-All features available with DSM 4.3, Audio Station 5.1 and onwards -Supported on devices running Android 2.3 and onwards Whatâs new?-Gapless playback in streaming mode (to the Android device) as well as in USB streaming mode-Entire albums can now be downloaded for Offline Listening as well as added to the Playing Queue/Playlists-When returning to a previous level, DS audio now remembers the point to which you had scrolled to before entering the album/artist/folder-Album artist tags are now displayed in the Album list-Airplay device password protection is now supported in DS audio-Fixed an issue where songs already downloaded were being downloaded again, potentially causing increased data usage -Minor bug fixes

reviews.title: Great app!
reviews.comment: (EDIT) all issues below are fixed! Yay!  This app (version 2.2.1-115) works superbly, but does not appear to cache anything.  At the start of each song, it downloads the song.  So if you pass out of solid connection range, the music quits.  And it needs a solid WiFi connection -- a 4G connection from a car works poorly if at all.  A simple cache of the last 250Mb of song files would make  improvement in functionality.  And it should pre-load the files in the queue.  With that, I\'d give it a 5
reviews.author: Kirby Moyers

reviews.title: Better than ever!
reviews.comment: Update 8/29/13: Synology just keeps outdoing themselves. They added gapless playback and the ability to download whole albums for offline play. I love how this company listens to its customers.  THANK YOU SYNOLOGY.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Finally can give 5 stars
reviews.comment: Have been waiting for the remembering of the scroll position on the previous page.  Now it is nearly perfect.
reviews.author: Jeff Royal

reviews.title: Great app.
reviews.comment: Wish it would support more than 1024 songs in a playlist.
reviews.author: Chris Butterfield

reviews.title: Tablet interface needs work
reviews.comment: I really like this app, however, as the title suggests the tablet interface needs work. There just seems to be so much space wasted. I can actually find what I am looking for easier on my Desire S then my Nexus 7. You could Give us an option to alter column sizes.
reviews.author: Ian Gallagher

reviews.title: Offline listening...
reviews.comment: Missing the ability to listen to offline music when launching the app and diskstation is unavailable
reviews.author: Soulier Benjamin

reviews.title: Still cannot see folders on Xperia tab z nor sgs2 apps
reviews.comment: App doesn\'t see my folders with music but it can find it on web version
reviews.author: Jack Luka

reviews.title: Excellent App for Synology users
reviews.comment: Love the fact that they are always improving and that they care about their user experience. Makes the synology NAS solutions that much more desirable.
reviews.author: Thomas Conway

reviews.title: Update has solved wireless speaker issue
reviews.comment: Please do not break the code!! It works fine as it is.
reviews.author: Jose Linares

reviews.title: Still useless to me...
reviews.comment: Sure it looks better and maybe some people will find the offline thing useful (though I can\'t see why using a file manager with SMB support wouldn\'t do as just as good a job) but no gapless playback makes this useless as a music player..!!!
reviews.author: Phillip Astle

reviews.title: Cue-sheet support
reviews.comment: Really love this app, but it would be a \"killer-app\" if Synology includes the support of cue-sheets. Would make my life easier :)
reviews.author: Ezra Verkijk

reviews.title: Excelent customer care !
reviews.comment: locally -  I don\'t care about that http non secured. Externally I use ssh tunnel with the port 5000 forwarded. So I simply connect to localhost:5000 and I am fine. The app still needs improvement. I hope the devs know their priorities. I can listen to music, so that\'s pretty enough for me. no crashes so far or annoying bugs. I\'ll post suggestions on Synology forums. Latest update : excelent work guys !!!!!
reviews.author: Gabriel Kozsar

reviews.title: Latest update broke 7/30/2013
reviews.comment: I just updated to the latest version and now it doesn\'t work on my Galaxy SII. Upon loading the app, it immediately crashes. Highly disappointing, as all previous versions have worked with my phone.
reviews.author: Jacob Murphy

reviews.title: Okay
reviews.comment: Can\'t play offline music without logging in, which defeats the purpose... Also, chromecast support would be great.
reviews.author: Jay Knight

reviews.title: Minor MP3 Duplication Error
reviews.comment: This app is amazing and keeps getting better, it seems like there are two things left to look into:  1. Songs set to save for offline mode often start duplicating themselves if you end up \"Streaming\" a song you already have locally saved from DS Audio already. You begin to see Song.mp3 Song1.mp3 (same exact one just duplicated with a number added after).  2. Wirelessly connecting to my NAS on the LAN network seems like it has hard capped read speeds when streaming and writing, so it takes long to download.
reviews.author: David Tercovich

reviews.title: 1 star for latest update
reviews.comment: Cannot login with the latest update. Screen goes back to login page after clicking login button, and cannot go to offline mode. Downgraded to version 3.0.2-159.
reviews.author: Julius Ordanza

reviews.title: Excellent App
reviews.comment: Good app, listen to all my songs anywhere in the world!!
reviews.author: Jared Yu

reviews.title: Great app.....
reviews.comment: since the last updated ds audio is terrible it won\'t play the tracks in order even when shuffle is off when shuffle is on when the final track of the album is played it stops even if all the other tracks haven\'t been played yet.... this happens on both my devices nexus4 (jb 4.3) and Asus transformer (ICS 4.0.1) and it\'s really slow on both!
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: Could be better, but still pretty great!
reviews.author: Tal Allweil

reviews.title: A good music player that works well with a NAS.
reviews.comment: Good, but could do with a graphic equaliser.
reviews.author: Nicholas Willett
